[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures (e.g., "The great man is linked to his age by his weakest side...").
[LEXICON]: Occasional archaic or untranslated terms (e.g., "saeculum mirabile") without context.

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between abstract historical principles (e.g., pendulum theory) and specific Victorian-era details.
[STRUCTURE]: Dense, unmarked leaps between broad philosophical ideas and granular 18th-century societal descriptions.

[LEXICON]: Archaic/colloquial phrasing (e.g., "in vulgar language, a going concern")

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt topic shifts (e.g., from working-class conditions to Victorian progress)
[TRANSITION]: Lack of explicit connections between paragraphs
